Description: Fragment of lip and body of East Greek pottery rosette bowl. Red and white lines on glazed interior. Reserved outside, with one rosette preserved above line at lower part of lip. Many calcareous inclusions in clay.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Heidelberg III / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Deutschland Heidelberg, Universität Band 3 (p.109 pl. 137.7)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1040)
